Package ohos.storageinfomgr

Class StorageInfoManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.storageinfomgr.StorageInfoManager

  • public final class StorageInfoManager
extends Object
    Queries the available space of storage volumes and the application storage information of a specified user.

    The storage information includes the application size, application data size, and application cached data size. It is stored in StorageInfo.

    Since:
    3
    See Also:
    StorageInfo
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.ResourceSchedule#STORAGE_INFO

    • Method Detail

      • newInstance

        public static StorageInfoManager newInstance​(Context context)
        A static factory method used to create a StorageInfoManager instance.
        Parameters:
        context - Indicates the application context.
        Returns:
        Returns a StorageInfoManager instance if the creation is successful; returns null if the context is null.
        Since:
        3

      • getFreeSize

        public long getFreeSize​(UUID storageUuid)
                 throws IOException
        Obtains the available space of a specified storage volume.

        The available space includes the remaining space and the cache data space that can be released.

        Parameters:
        storageUuid - Indicates the storage volume to be queried. You can query the value using Volume.getVolUuid().
        Returns:
        Returns the available size of the specified storage volume, in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the storage volume to be queried does not exist.
        Since:
        3

      • getWholeSize

        public long getWholeSize​(UUID storageUuid)
                  throws IOException
        Obtains the total space of a specified storage volume.
        Parameters:
        storageUuid - Indicates the UUID of the storage volume to be queried. You can obtain the UUID using Volume.getVolUuid().
        Returns:
        Returns the total size of the specified storage volume, in bytes.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the storage volume to be queried does not exist.
        Since:
        4

      • queryInfoByPackageName

        public StorageInfo queryInfoByPackageName​(UUID storageUuid,
                                          String packageName,
                                          int uid)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          NotExistException
        Obtains the storage information of a specified application that belongs to a specified user on a specified storage volume.
        Parameters:
        storageUuid - Indicates the UUID of the storage volume to be queried. You can obtain the UUID using Volume.getVolUuid().
        packageName - Indicates the name of the application package to be queried.
        uid - Indicates the ID of the user to be queried. You can obtain the user ID using IBundleManager.getUidByBundleName(java.lang.String, int).
        Returns:
        Returns the storage status of the application. For details, see StorageInfo.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the storage volume to be queried does not exist.
        NotExistException - Throws this exception if the queried package does not exist.
        Since:
        3

      • queryInfoByUid

        public StorageInfo queryInfoByUid​(UUID storageUuid,
                                  int uid)
                           throws IOException
        Obtains the application storage status of a specified user on a specified storage volume.
        Parameters:
        storageUuid - Indicates the storage volume to be queried. You can query the value using Volume.getVolUuid().
        uid - Indicates the ID of the user to be queried. You can obtain the user ID using IBundleManager.getUidByBundleName(java.lang.String, int).
        Returns:
        Returns the storage status of the specified user. For details, see StorageInfo.
        Throws:
        IOException - Throws this exception if the storage volume to be queried does not exist.
        Since:
        3
